title: 115_s1945
content: The "Keep Americans Safe Act" defines a 'large capacity ammunition feeding device' as any device that can hold or be converted to hold more than 10 rounds of ammunition, excluding .22 caliber rimfire ammunition. It also clarifies the term 'qualified law enforcement officer'. The Keep Americans Safe Act prohibits the import, sale, manufacture, transfer, or possession of large capacity ammunition feeding devices in interstate or foreign commerce. Exceptions include devices lawfully possessed before the enactment date and those used by qualified law enforcement officers. The curr_chunk discusses exceptions to the prohibition of large capacity ammunition feeding devices, including possession by law enforcement officers for law enforcement purposes, importation for establishing security systems under Federal law, and possession by retired individuals. Exceptions to the prohibition of large capacity ammunition feeding devices include possession by retired law enforcement officers and licensed manufacturers for testing purposes. Enforcement officer defined as individual employed by private institution of higher education eligible for funding under title IV of Higher Education Act, responsible for crime prevention or investigation, authorized to carry firearm, execute search warrants, and make arrests, recognized by government entity as law enforcement officer. Amendments made to identification markings for large capacity ammunition feeding devices under Section 923(i) of title 18, United States Code. The Keep Americans Safe Act requires all devices manufactured after its enactment to have a serial number and manufacturing date engraved on them. Section 924(d) of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include large capacity ammunition feeding devices in seizure and forfeiture regulations. The Keep Americans Safe Act mandates serial numbers and manufacturing dates on all devices manufactured post-enactment. Section 924(d) of title 18, United States Code, is amended to include large capacity ammunition feeding devices in seizure and forfeiture regulations. Amendments include adding "or large capacity ammunition feeding devices" in paragraph (2)(C) and inserting "922(v)," in paragraph (3)(E). SEC. 4. PENALTIES amended to include section 924(a)(1)(B) of title 18, United States Code, adding "(q), or (v)". SEC. 5. Byrne grants can now be used for buy-back programs for large capacity ammunition feeding devices. SEC. 6. SEVERABILITY. SEC. 6. SEVERABILITY. If any provision of this Act or its amendments is deemed unconstitutional, the rest of the Act and its amendments will not be affected.
